resources.string: Please choose your NavigationActivity\'s type to continue
1. Select an animation for your transaction
Add current Fragment to back stack
This is the position of the current fragment in the navigation chain
If the switch is checked, this fragment will not be added to back stack which means that it will not be attached again on back press

This will override the default transaction animation, which means that all the upcoming transaction animations will be the selected one, unless you change it again. Note that if a fragment was already attached using a specific animation, the closing animation won\'t change by changing default animation

Switch will replace the current fragment by a new fragment. This will destroy the fragment and clears it from memory. This is a good approach if your fragments save heavy data. Note that when you navigate back to the fragment, all of it\'s states are restored
Navigate will attach a new fragment on top of the current fragment. This will keep the previous fragment alive and won\'t destroy it. This is a good approach for fragments with light data

Restart will clear the back-stack and replace the current fragment by a new one. This means that the previously attached fragments won\'t be accessible if you navigate back and will be completely destroyed and cleared from memory. This is a good approach for single-launch screens such as login, registration, welcomeâ€¦ etc
